Putin načrtuje rusko alternativo Wikipediji
06 Nov 2019, 11:22 by STA

Ruski predsednik Vladimir Putin je v torek predlagal oblikovanje ruske alternative spletni enciklopediji Wikipedija. Takšna alternativa globalni enciklopediji bi bila namreč po njegovem mnenju zanesljivejša oziroma bolj zaupanja vredna. Kremelj namerava za projekt do leta 2022 nameniti 1,7 milijarde rubljev (24 milijonov evrov).



Ruski predsednik Vladimir Putin načrtuje oblikovanje ruske alternative spletni enciklopediji Wikipedija. Kremelj namerava za projekt do leta 2022 nameniti 1,7 milijarde rubljev (24 milijonov evrov).  Foto: pixabay.com

MOSKVA > "Ko gre za Wikipedijo, bi jo bilo bolje zamenjati z novo Veliko rusko enciklopedijo v elektronski obliki," je v Kremlju na srečanju komisije, pristojne za prihodnost ruskega jezika, izjavil ruski predsednik Vladimir Putin.
"Če ne drugega, bodo tam zaupanja vredne informacije, predstavljene na dober in sodoben način," je dodal po poročanju ruske tiskovne agencije Ria Novosti.
Velika ruska enciklopedija, ki jo je imel v mislih Putin, je izhajala med letoma 2007 in 2014, za zdaj pa je na voljo le v papirnati obliki.
Rusko alternativo Wikipedije je Putin predlagal le nekaj dni po uveljavitvi spornega zakona, ki ruskim oblastnem omogoča osamitev interneta v državi. Oblasti trdijo, da je cilj zakona, ki je v veljavo stopil v petek, zaščititi Rusijo pred kibernetskimi grožnjami, kritike pa skrbi, da bo še okrepil cenzuro na spletu.
Putin je rusko spletno enciklopedijo predlagal tudi v odzivu na javno izraženo nezadovoljstvo rektorja ene izmed ruskih univerz, češ da celo sodišča za utemeljitev kazni uporabljajo Wikipedijo.
Ruske oblasti so leta 2015 za krajši čas prepovedale Wikipedijo, kjer naj bi eno izmed gesel po njihovem mnenju vsebovalo napotke za pripravo mamila iz kanabisa.
Različica Wikipedije v ruskem jeziku navaja, da trenutno vsebuje več kot milijon in pol gesel.

Putin plans Russian alternative to Wikipedia
06 Nov 2019, 11:22 by STA

Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday proposed the creation of a Russian alternative to the Wikipedia online encyclopedia. Such an alternative to the global encyclopedia would, in his view, be more reliable or more trustworthy. The Kremlin plans to allocate 1.7 billion rubles (€ 24 million) to the project by 2022.



Russian President Vladimir Putin plans to design Russian alternative to Wikipedia's online encyclopedia. The Kremlin plans to allocate 1.7 billion rubles (€ 24 million) to the project by 2022. Photo credit: pixabay.com

MOSCOW> "When it comes to Wikipedia, it would be better to replace it with the new Great Russian Encyclopedia in electronic form," Russian President Vladimir Putin said at a meeting of the commission responsible for the future of the Russian language.
"If nothing else, there will be trusted information presented in a good and up-to-date way," he added, according to Russian news agency Ria Novosti.
The great Russian encyclopedia that Putin had in mind was published between 2007 and 2014, and so far it is only available in paper form.
Putin proposed the Russian alternative to Wikipedia just days after the controversial law came into force, allowing Russian authorities to isolate the country's Internet. Authorities say the law, which came into force on Friday, aims to protect Russia from cyber threats, and critics worry it will further strengthen online censorship.
Putin also suggested a Russian online encyclopedia in response to publicly expressed dissatisfaction with the rector of one of the Russian universities, saying that even courts use Wikipedia to justify punishment.
In 2015, the Russian authorities banned Wikipedia for a short time, which allegedly contained instructions for preparing cannabis drugs.
The Russian-language version of Wikipedia states that it currently contains over a million and a half passwords.
